thread.title: Gaussin to Automate Port of Shanghai
thread.title_full: Gaussin to Automate Port of Shanghai

author: porttechnology.org
title: Gaussin to Automate Port of Shanghai
text:
Yangshan Container Terminal, the deepwater container terminal of the Port of Shanghai, announced on September 8, 2015, the results of the tender to automate its port terminal, with Gaussin participating as one of four companies.  The order from Yangshan Container Terminal is for 50 AGV’s in the context of “public policy” for the automating of major Chinese ports, undertaken in late 2014 by the People's Republic of China.
The prospective equipment offered by Gaussin will include, for a total of more than US$69 million, 50 Automotive Intelligent Vehicles, 66 Full Electric powerpacks and one fleet management solution.
The current command should be followed by a tender for the supply of 80 automated AIVs in May, 2016 with a fleet of 50-130 vehicles.
Gaussin has also been involved with the full atuomation of a container terminal under construction in Héricourt, France, in the same location as the company's head offices.
For all the latest on Gaussin, click here
